detail.head: Machine Learning Instructor | StarLight Academy
detail.article:
- Conducted Machine Learning bootcamp. Topics Covered:
- Version Control and Jupyter – Introduction to Git/GitHub and Prototyping Environment.
- Data Visualization – Introduction to charts like scatter plot, bar chart, pie charts and other categories in Matplotlib.
- Machine Learning techniques – Linear and Logistic Regression, SVMs, Naïve Bayes, Random Forests and Regularization.
- Deep Learning techniques – Neural Network, Convolutional Neural Networks and Recurrent Neural Networks.

detail.head: Machine Learning Intern | Untrodden Labs
detail.article:
Responsible for iteratively training, testing and deploying deep learning models that can automate the process of reducing electricity consumption.
- Train and Tested Non-Intrusive Load Monitoring (NILM) Deep Learning models in Python using TensorFlow.
- Deployed the model using TensorFlow-serving on AWS.
- Migrated the deployed model from AWS to Google Cloud as the company decided to migrate.
- Current NILM system scores an – F1 score for different appliances varied between 0.1 and 0.9 over test set.
- Developed prototype for Deep Reinforcement Learning applied to Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems for consumption reduction.
- The Deep RL model gave 12% improvement in simulated environment.

detail.head: Parameter Estimation of Software Reliability Growth Models Using Krill Herd Algorithm.
detail.article: The proposed approach put forward an effective estimation of the parameters for software reliability growth models with the help of Krill Herd Algorithm. The Software Reliability Growth model is considered to be incomplete, if the parameters of model are not known and are not validated over failure datasets. Many techniques are present for estimating parameters of model based on numerical estimation, but the scope of quality enhancement still remain open. The proposed Krill Herd Algorithm based approach outclasses the problems of numerical estimation. The proposed work is validated over four real-time datasets. Check it here.
